pros: Amazing and rewarding work. Love this clinic
cons: This is not a job for you if you do not love working with children

review_title: Staff are awesome, love the kids - Pay mediocre.
job_title: School Library Media Specialist in Greenfield, NH
pros: Great camaraderie, staff committed and solid. Relaxed atmosphere and culture. Rewarding
cons: Poor pay for most of the staff, the paras who do most of the heavy lifting with clients. Professional staff: certified teachers, admins, BCBAs, etc paid decently. Since Gersh Autism took over, I can't speak to it much. They said they wanted to do no harm to anyone and not change much, then they fired a lot of well-paid teachers to replace them with hourly paras.

review_title: Same downfalls as many other direct care jobs
pros: Rewarding work, free food, option to live on campus for cheap, many bonuses during COVID, difficult to get fired
cons: Low hourly pay, disorganized management, little to no accountability for treatment of clients, a lot of sketchy things get swept under the rug, little to no accountability for staff behavior, sometimes micro-managing and managers with God complexes, difficult to get fired

pros:
Great coworkers
Lots of support
Small teams
Flexible hours
cons:
Lack of promotion opportunities
Lack of professional development
No cost of living increases or raises 
Lack of transparency with upper management

pros:
Kept clients very active with fun activities
Management almost always available when someone needed help
cons:
Consistently hired inexperienced staff
Consistently hired staff who didn’t speak English- makes it impossible when the clients already have communication difficulties
Things got swept under the rug with staff issues

pros: The people and the kids
cons: Gersh bought this company out, demoted all case managers, fired BCBA’s because it wasn’t “working out” and new staff are training new staff in a field in they have no experience in.

pros: Great Environment to work in, great company
cons: The health benefits should be better.

job_title: Coordinator, Student Services in Greenfield, NH
pros: Great students, understanding parents and Guardians. Supportive coworkers
cons: Management is making some heartless decisions trying to fix the company

review_title: Great kids, great people, not great pay
job_title: Student Service Coordinator in Greenfield, NH
pros: Coworkers were fantastic, love the studnets
cons: Pay is much too low to keep quality employees

review_title: This place is hanging on by a thread
pros:
Free school lunch and fruit to snack on. 
Beautiful views of mountains. 
Farm school sells local grown produce and syrup 
Swimming pool use for staff
Can wear casual clothing to school
cons:
You are not able to teach as you are a child’s 1:1 staff everyday due to the school being short 20 staff in the school. No prep time during the day, no duty free lunch nor duty free breaks. 

Due to the very liberal restrain policy of the NH law, students are not prevented from leaving the class nor the school, even if they are being unsafe, don’t have Safety awareness nor the intellectual ability to reason. 

The staff are unhappy due to the lack of resources, support to be effective from management and there is not a culture of innovation nor team work. 

High staff evacuation currently that has to be addressed.

pros: They hire new grads and are able to work with different brain and spinal cord injuries. Have a chance to learn how to take care of ventilators and respiratory patients. The floor staff is great to work with. Great teamwork.
cons: Everyone is a new nurse. You have to be able to learn on the fly, which can be bad if you don't handle stress well. They take the good nurses off the floor and move them to administration. They can't seem to keep a nurse manager around for more than a few moths at a time. They are very top heavy in the hospital administration and not always enough support for new hires especially at night. Even though there is a lot of respiratory patients they will only pay to have RT durning the day.

pros: The residents are special and you can make a positive impact in their lives
cons: No matter what happens, the company will go to great lengths to make it your fault and not theirs.  I got stabbed by a rssident and won a trip to the ER.  I don't blame the resident at all, he wasn't  in control of himself.  I then had to attend a meeting where NO ONE asked me about my injuries but 7 management types all sat around and literally came up with how this incident was 100% my fault and armchair quartebacked what I should have done differently to prevent this.  After the first couple of minutes it was talking about me in third person "well, he could have done this..." no for how to prevent others for getting hurt, but how they were not liable.

review_title: Highly disorganized, disrespect to staff, poor management strategies.
pros: Health insurance, set hours, reliable pay. Overtime regularly available for those interested. Holiday pay in place of days off. Plenty of accrued vacation time.
cons: Violent clients, lack of support from management, dramatic reduction in "perks" and refusal to give proper breaks or food. Management can be hostile to any suggestion of change and does not tend to listen to people actually working WITH the clients until someone gets seriously injured.

job_title: Residential Counselor II in Greenfield, NH
pros: The administration is nice: they treat the personnel with dignity. I have worked at Crotched Montain Rehabilitation Center for one year and none of the management line has been rough with me. They're nice people.
cons:
The downsides at Crotched Mountain Rehabilitation Center is about stagnant salaries. You don't expect longevity salary encrement as long as you stay at the same position. I think here should be annual afvantage plan overwise staff retention rate will stay low!
Also, employment risk protection plan should be much clear and enhanced.

pros:
Free Lunch
Flexible Scheduling (they will work with you) 
Developing good rapport with clients and teachers
Good place to get your foot in the door for Spec. ED
They're ALWAYS looking for people
Part Time/ Full Time/ and Pardiem openings
cons:
Dangerous work environment
Low Staff Morale 
Low teacher morale
HR and Management jerking people around 
No real breaks

pros: The have health benefits for all full time employees.
cons:
Used to be fun and felt like a good place to work.  Not anymore for residential counselors and school staff as the management is so restrictive and have endless rules on what you can't do.  There's is not a feeling of being truly valued.  The crisis response team members seem lazy and make much more money than counselors and
school staff.  Lots of work and lots of risk of getting hurt by a resident.

pros: The facility provides greatly for the clients and staff. There are numerous resources available for the clients, such as, therapy gyms, nature trails, and even a library. The therapist and psychologists are on site and often visit clients in home and at school. There are truly skilled individuals here that greatly care for the clients and the improvement of their lives. The job is very fufulling and you gain a lot of experience working with these indiviuals.
cons: Hiring staff with ZERO experience working with special needs children, lack of properly trained staff (hands on client based), high turn over ratio, extreme gossip, and high risk of injury while on the job (from lack of training). Staff are placed with violent and behavioral clients with little to no training in some cases. Staff are not properly reprimanded when violating work procedure; for exampe, staff are often on their cell phones and not paying attention to their clients (This needs to be greatly addressed). Lack of team support and motivation with in staff. I have heard staff say "not my circus not my monkey". The severe lack of team work and support for clients can be devistating to witness. This brings any one's work moral and ethic down to witness such horrible attitude. Poor traning leads to many individuals being injured on the job. Myself included when told that I was uncomfortable in a situation and did not want to work with a client was told that there was no other choice. There is always a choice.

job_title: Paraeducator II/Residential Counselor in Greenfield, NH
pros: If you like working with special needs children and adults this is a great place to gain experience working with a wide variety of needs very quickly. You'll have opportunities to with speech therapists, physical therapists, and pretty much every type of therapist. Its a great learning experience in that respect. Students use a wide variety of augmentative communication tools which you will have the opportunity to learn about.
cons: Communication is really terrible to the point where it effects the safety of employees. Some kids and adults who work here are violent and have on several occasions sent staff to the hospital. Also if you let them they will throw you with any kid without proper training which as explained earlier, is not safe with these kids.

pros: The clients you work for
cons: Management, their attitude and there lack of support is the worst. Followed by very low pay.

job_title: Licensed Nursing Assistant in Greenfield, NH
pros: The clients, as long as you can handle high need patients
cons: The management and constant changing rules and schedules

review_title: Excellent people, not so good conditions

pros: Health benefits, great working environment, management tries as much as possible to maintain safe work environment for both client and staff.
cons: Your pay remains the same as when hired. You cannot ask for your wages to be reviewed even is performance is efficient

pros: None they use to be a great company

You NEVER get to take your vacation or sick time. They always say that they do not have enough coverage
